glsa.title: BIND: Multiple vulnerabilities
glsa.synopsis: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in BIND, the worst of which may allow remote Denial of Service.

background.p: BIND is the Berkeley Internet Name Domain Server.

description.p: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in BIND:

ul.li: Domain names are not properly revoked due to an error in the cache update policy (CVE-2012-1033).
BIND accepts records with zero-length RDATA fields (CVE-2012-1667).
An assertion failure from the failing-query cache could occur when DNSSEC validation is enabled (CVE-2012-3817).
A memory leak may occur under high TCP query loads (CVE-2012-3868).
An assertion error can occur when a query is performed for a record with RDATA greater than 65535 bytes (CVE-2012-4244).

impact.p: A remote attacker may be able to cause a Denial of Service condition or keep domain names resolvable after it has been deleted from registration.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
